content:
• Monday, December 19, 2011
  • S

    Sprint (NYSE:S) issues a statement in response to AT&T's (NYSE:T) decision to end its bid to...

    Sprint (NYSE:S) issues a statement in response to AT&T's (NYSE:T) decision to end its bid to takeover T-Mobile (OTCQX:DTEGY), calling it "the right decision for consumers, competition and innovation in the wireless industry." S now up 6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHTR

    Charter Communications (NASDAQ:CHTR) names its new President and CEO: Thomas Rutledge, the...

    Charter Communications (NASDAQ:CHTR) names its new President and CEO: Thomas Rutledge, the just-resigned, widely-praised Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) COO. CHTR +3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) uses its FQ3 earnings call to guide for FQ4 revenue of $289M-$292M and EPS of...

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) uses its FQ3 earnings call to guide for FQ4 revenue of $289M-$292M and EPS of $0.26-$0.27; the latter meshes well with a consensus of $0.26, but the former is below a consensus of $292.5M. Red Hat shares, which fell after the company issued its FQ3 report (I, II), are now down 9.5% AH. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • SRE

    Sempra Energy (NYSE:SRE) rises 1.2% after stating its expects to meet or exceed the high end of...

    Sempra Energy (NYSE:SRE) rises 1.2% after stating its expects to meet or exceed the high end of its 2011 EPS guidance range of $4-$4.30 ($4.21 Street consensus). The diversified energy firm says all of its businesses "have met or exceeded their financial objectives for the year."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • T

    AT&T (NYSE:T) ends its bid to acquire T-Mobile (OTCQX:DTEGY), taking a $4B Q4 charge for...

    AT&T (NYSE:T) ends its bid to acquire T-Mobile (OTCQX:DTEGY), taking a $4B Q4 charge for "break-up considerations." The two plan to enter a "mutually beneficial roaming agreement." T shares -0.5% AH, but Sprint (NYSE:S) - which would have been relegated to a junior league carrier if the deal went through - shoots higher, +8.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 7 Comments
  • RHT

    More on Red Hat's FQ3 report: The company's deferred revenue balance reached $819.6M - up 20%...

    More on Red Hat's FQ3 report: The company's deferred revenue balance reached $819.6M - up 20% Y/Y but less than 1% Q/Q. Expect this figure to receive some scrutiny. Free cash flow rose 41% Y/Y, to $85.5M, well above net income of $55.7M. RHT -10.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • BTX

    BioTime (BTX +1%) finishes the day in positive territory after WBB Securities upgraded the stock...

    BioTime (BTX +1%) finishes the day in positive territory after WBB Securities upgraded the stock earlier today to Strong Buy, citing the potential of cancer detection device PanC-Dx.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • ECHO

    Shares of Echo Global Logistics (ECHO -4.1%) take a hit after Stifel Nicolaus cuts the company...

    Shares of Echo Global Logistics (ECHO -4.1%) take a hit after Stifel Nicolaus cuts the company to Hold from Buy on valuation. The stock has had a strong run, gaining nearly 40% since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • URI

    Oppenheimer bumps its price target on United Rentals (URI +1.5%) to $37 from $29 in the wake of...

    Oppenheimer bumps its price target on United Rentals (URI +1.5%) to $37 from $29 in the wake of its planned $1.87B acquisition of RSC Holdings (RRR-OLD +1.3%). The combination should result in "significant growth" the next several years, it says, and "momentum is robust near-term" as both companies' Oct. and Nov. rental revenue "far exceeded our expectations."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • BAC

    Word that BofA (BAC -4.8%) trades below $5 could test the mettle of value investor Warren...

    Word that BofA (BAC -4.8%) trades below $5 could test the mettle of value investor Warren Buffett as his paper loss on warrants pushes over $1B - presumably a big number even for the Oracle. But cushioning the blow for Buffett will be the $300M in dividends he rakes annually no matter how far down into the abysss BAC falls.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 20 Comments
  • DAL

    Airline stocks sell off after last week's gains, but Maxim Group says the carriers as a group...

    Airline stocks sell off after last week's gains, but Maxim Group says the carriers as a group "remain attractive in light of actions the airlines have taken to control capacity and costs... we expect to see the whole sector rally by spring." Carriers recently have reported generally solid traffic and revenue metrics. Today: DAL -5.8%, UAL -4.7%, JBLU -7.4%, LUV -4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • LF

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF -3%) dip after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Hold from Buy on...

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF -3%) dip after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Hold from Buy on valuation, saying the stock has already priced in a strong holiday, and supply constraints pose a potential risk to estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • DEER

    Deer Consumer (OTC:DEER -7.6%) is seeing heavy volatility for the third straight trading day...

    Deer Consumer (OTC:DEER -7.6%) is seeing heavy volatility for the third straight trading day (previously). In what might be further proof of how speculators have latched onto boutique research firms issuing bearish reports on Chinese companies, today's decline appears to be the result of long-time Deer critic Alfred Little merely announcing plans to issue a report on the company tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • SCHN

    Schnitzer Steel's (SCHN -8.5%) downward guidance of FQ1 results due to a weaker-than-anticipated...

    Schnitzer Steel's (SCHN -8.5%) downward guidance of FQ1 results due to a weaker-than-anticipated global market for recycled metals, following Friday's warning from Steel Dynamics (STLD -3.6%), weighs on steel shares: X -7.7%, NUE  -1.8%, AKS -0.4%. Natural resource stocks also slide: CLF -6.5%, FCX -3%, SCCO -2.8%, AA -2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • EBF

    Ennis (EBF -4.8%) dips after its Q3 beats on on per share basis but misses on revenue, due to...

    Ennis (EBF -4.8%) dips after its Q3 beats on on per share basis but misses on revenue, due to softness in the market and competitive pricing pressures. Margins dipped Y/Y to 24.8% from 27.1% on higher input costs and reduced sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -4.3%) shares drop to a $4 handle for the first time since the week of...

    Bank of America (BAC -4.3%) shares drop to a $4 handle for the first time since the week of March 6, 2009 when American stocks overall put in their epic bear market bottom. Shares are now trading at $4.97.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 29 Comments
  • IBM

    Selling in IBM (IBM -0.1%) appears to have abated somewhat today, following five consecutive...

    Selling in IBM (IBM -0.1%) appears to have abated somewhat today, following five consecutive days of losses after hitting a 52-week high recently.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • VHC

    Shares of VirnetX (VHC +17.4%) spike higher on word that Apple's request with a federal court to...

    Shares of VirnetX (VHC +17.4%) spike higher on word that Apple's request with a federal court to reexamine a VirnetX patent has been denied (ruling).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • BPR

    General Growth Properties (GGP -0.8%) trades down after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral...

    General Growth Properties (GGP -0.8%) trades down after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral on relative valuation, citing reduced internal and external growth expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • WPP-OLD

    Wausau Paper (WPP-OLD +0.5%) agrees to sell its remaining 80K timberland holdings in northern...

    Wausau Paper (WPP-OLD +0.5%) agrees to sell its remaining 80K timberland holdings in northern Wisconsin for $43M. The deal will close before the end of the year, with proceeds to be applied toward reducing financing requirements associated with the company's expansion project in the tissue business.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • ALKS

    Alkermes (ALKS +0.5%) says it's initiated Phase 3 clinical trials of ALKS 9070, its proprietary...

    Alkermes (ALKS +0.5%) says it's initiated Phase 3 clinical trials of ALKS 9070, its proprietary molecule designed to provide patients with a once-monthly dose for the treatment of schizophrenia. Results from the study, if positive, will be used to file a New Drug Application with the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Israeli biotech Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD -4%) dips after agreeing to sell its 50% stake in...

    Israeli biotech Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD -4%) dips after agreeing to sell its 50% stake in Rosetta Green, as the firm seeks to improve its cash position and expand the commercialization of its products.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM

  • Though corn futures trade 3.3% higher today on concern that dry weather is South America will...

    Though corn futures trade 3.3% higher today on concern that dry weather is South America will lower crop yields for some areas, Macquarie calls for a downward trend in 2012. "With the expected expiry of the ethanol tax credit and a possible weakening of feed demand due to lower meat consumption related to the sluggish economy, corn demand growth may ease."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • HEI

    Aircraft component maker Heico (HEI -0.3%) drifts lower after Auriga cut the shares to Hold on...

    Aircraft component maker Heico (HEI -0.3%) drifts lower after Auriga cut the shares to Hold on valuation, saying the company is looking at tough Y/Y comparisons in its Flight Support Group in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • NYT

    New York Times (NYT -2.9%) confirms an earlier report that it's in "advanced" discussions to...

    New York Times (NYT -2.9%) confirms an earlier report that it's in "advanced" discussions to sell its regional newspapers, identifying Halifax Media Group as the potential buyer of 16 publications across the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • PNW

    Pinnacle West (PNW -0.8%) trades lower after Credit Suisse cut its rating to Neutral earlier...

    Pinnacle West (PNW -0.8%) trades lower after Credit Suisse cut its rating to Neutral earlier today, citing risks surrounding its settled but not yet approved APS rate case, adding that room to positively surprise does not appear likely from current expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +3%) gains on reports that the Chinese government has barred state-owned Baotou...

    Molycorp (MCP +3%) gains on reports that the Chinese government has barred state-owned Baotou Steel - the largest producer of minerals in the world - from exporting its products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • CALX

    Morgan Stanley's gloomy outlook for networking stocks is especially hard on Calix (CALX -9.4%),...

    Morgan Stanley's gloomy outlook for networking stocks is especially hard on Calix (CALX -9.4%), which it says is suffering from a delay in government spending on broadband and from weaker spending among telcoms. MS sees capex among carriers slowing in 2012, to +2.2% from +3.5% in 2011. Estimates and price targets also cut for JNPR +0.1%, ADTN -1.2%, FNSR -4.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • DTE

    DTE Energy (DTE +1.3%) moves up after Credit Suisse raises its rating on the shares to...

    DTE Energy (DTE +1.3%) moves up after Credit Suisse raises its rating on the shares to Outperform, saying the positive regulatory environment in Michigan - where the company is headquartered - should translate into 5-6% EPS growth, plus a slightly better than group 4.6% dividend yield.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • WNS

    WNS (WNS +5.6%) jumps after Baird ups the shares to Outperform from Neutral on valuation, citing...

    WNS (WNS +5.6%) jumps after Baird ups the shares to Outperform from Neutral on valuation, citing positive sales trends and a potential raising of estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • NYT

    New York Times (NYT -3.5%) plans to sell off regional newspapers, according to a developing...

    New York Times (NYT -3.5%) plans to sell off regional newspapers, according to a developing story from one of the firm's own reporters at its flagship publication. Last week, the company announced a change in direction in its CEO office.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +0.9%) edges higher after stating its global retail sales of construction and...

    Caterpillar (CAT +0.9%) edges higher after stating its global retail sales of construction and mining equipment rose 30% Y/Y in the September-November period, buoyed by strong North American demand. However, growth faltered a little in November, particularly in Latin America. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • MRK

    Trius (TSRX -8.5%) have done a rapid about-face - after opening nearly 8.4% higher - on the...

    Trius (TSRX -8.5%) have done a rapid about-face - after opening nearly 8.4% higher - on the heels of a conference call it held just before the open to discuss the recent results of its Phase 3 trial for its tedizolid treatment for acute bacterial skin infections.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (SFLY +3.3%) gains on positive comments out of Baird this morning, saying the shares...

    Shutterfly (SFLY +3.3%) gains on positive comments out of Baird this morning, saying the shares have near-bottomed and investors should begin accumulating the stock. Baird adds that the ongoing shift to online photo sites from the traditional retail channel is a growth niche, and the competitive environment has created an opportunity for the company to expand to the mass market.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • BWLD

    It's a two-day rally for shares of Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +3.7%) after Miller Tabak fired up a...

    It's a two-day rally for shares of Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +3.7%) after Miller Tabak fired up a Buy rating on shares Friday. George Liu weighs in on the momentum BWLD is building, noting the firm has logged 4 years of consecutive EPS growth - while also increasing sales without adding debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • BDC

    Networking cable maker Belden (BDC -1.1%) trades lower after stating it will make a C$22/share...

    Networking cable maker Belden (BDC -1.1%) trades lower after stating it will make a C$22/share ($C280M) offer for RuggedCom, a Canadian maker of industrial-grade networking gear. RuggedCom says it has formed a special committee to evaluate Belden's proposal. Its shares are currently trading at C$22.66 on the Toronto exchange (up 66.5%), which suggests investors expect a higher bid.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • ABMD

    Abiomed (ABMD -2.4%) dips after being downgraded to Market Underperform on valuation at Rodman...

    Abiomed (ABMD -2.4%) dips after being downgraded to Market Underperform on valuation at Rodman & Renshaw, citing clinical and reimbursement concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • BAC

    Another day, another analyst ax to forecasts for big banks (XLF -2.1%): This time, it's Nomura...

    Another day, another analyst ax to forecasts for big banks (XLF -2.1%): This time, it's Nomura cutting Q4 earnings estimates for several, citing “the difficult trading backdrop, soft investment banking trends [and] limited expense flexibility." Share price targets are lowered: BAC to $7 from $8, C to $36 from $38, GS to $130 from $141, MS to $18 from $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -5.3%) looks like an IPO in trouble after a second down day following its sub-$10...

    Zynga (ZNGA -5.3%) looks like an IPO in trouble after a second down day following its sub-$10 close on Friday. Analysts proceed cautiously: Cowen picks up coverage at Neutral, Sterne Agee starts at Underperform with a $7 target, and Morningstar says fair value on the stock is ~$6. Other social media shares may be feeling the heat: GRPN -3.1%, LNKD -0.6%, SINA -3.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 11 Comments
  • SNBR

    Piper Jaffray helps propel shares of Select Comfort (SCSS +3.3%) with a reiteration of its...

    Piper Jaffray helps propel shares of Select Comfort (SCSS +3.3%) with a reiteration of its Overweight rating and $23 price target on shares after the bed manufacturer's management resoundedly won over analysts with the firm. "We continue to believe SCSS is one of the best growth stories in our coverage universe. Additionally, we believe SCSS shares are likely to see earnings multiple expansion over the coming months."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM

  • European shares give up the bulk of the day's rally as Mario Draghi wraps up his prepared...

    European shares give up the bulk of the day's rally as Mario Draghi wraps up his prepared remarks to EU Parliament. Whether his words had anything to do with it is up for argument, but David Song summarizes Draghi's message as "We will support the banking sector, but not public finances." Stoxx 50 +0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • YZC

    Yanzhou Coal (YZC -3.8%) will reportedly purchase Australia's Gloucester Coal for at least $2B,...

    Yanzhou Coal (YZC -3.8%) will reportedly purchase Australia's Gloucester Coal for at least $2B, according to sources talking to Bloomberg. At the moment, shares of YZC are halted pending a news announcement.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -2.5%) shares slide despite a new Outperform rating and $30 price target from...

    Groupon (GRPN -2.5%) shares slide despite a new Outperform rating and $30 price target from Barrington. Perhaps earning more cachet, Deutsche Bank and Stifel Nicolaus come out with Hold ratings (I, II) amid concerns GRPN's $15B valuation already discounts several years of growth and margin expansion, which may not materialize as expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • PLCE

    Sterne Agee lowers its rating on Children's Place Retail Stores (PLCE -3.9%) to Neutral from Buy...

    Sterne Agee lowers its rating on Children's Place Retail Stores (PLCE -3.9%) to Neutral from Buy on concerns that the childrens apparel retailer may see reduced earnings due to warm weather trends in North America seen in Q4 and the "highly promotional" environment in the sector. Analysts with the firm clipped their price target on shares by $2 to $60.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • CVC

    More on Cablevision: While Citi's support is helping Cablevision recoup some of Friday's huge...

    More on Cablevision: While Citi's support is helping Cablevision recoup some of Friday's huge losses, doubts continue to exist about the the Dolan family's ability to run Cablevision competently in Rutledge's absence, given their history of infighting and questionable decisions. Concerns also exist about their willingness to sell the company, in spite of likely M&A interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • LPX

    Louisiana-Pacific (LPX -1.5%) dips after being downgraded to Reduce on valuation by TD Newcrest....

    Louisiana-Pacific (LPX -1.5%) dips after being downgraded to Reduce on valuation by TD Newcrest. The stock has been a solid performer during the recent fall rally, gaining over 42% since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • RPTP

    Raptor Pharmaceuticals (RPTP +4.4%) pokes out a tidy gain after the firm announces that it...

    Raptor Pharmaceuticals (RPTP +4.4%) pokes out a tidy gain after the firm announces that it signed a R&D agreement with the National Institutes of Diabetes and Digestive and Lidney Diseases to conduct a Phase 2b clinical trial in Q1 on the efficacy of its RP104 tablet.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • C

    Early green in the major averages is masking another decline in the TBTF banks, led today by...

    Early green in the major averages is masking another decline in the TBTF banks, led today by Citigroup (C -3.7%) and Bank of America (BAC -2.8%). BofA again flirts with a $4 handle, matching a 52 week low of $5.02.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • CVC

    Citigroup adds Cablevision (CVC +3.2%) to its Top Picks Live list, seeing "compelling value" in...

    Citigroup adds Cablevision (CVC +3.2%) to its Top Picks Live list, seeing "compelling value" in the shares after the market selloff in reaction to the resignation of its COO was "way overdone." Citi maintains its Buy rating and $21 price target but cites potential for "30% to 95% upside" in the shares after dropping 27% since late October and 8.5% last Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • CAR

    Zipcar (ZIP +7.1%) goes on a run after Oppenheimer reiterates an Outperform rating on the...

    Zipcar (ZIP +7.1%) goes on a run after Oppenheimer reiterates an Outperform rating on the strength of the firm's string of momentum-building announcements. News of a distribution by a VC shareholder also caught the eye of investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • JAKK

    Shares of toymaker Jakks Pacific (JAKK -20.5%) unravel after the firm releases updated 2011...

    Shares of toymaker Jakks Pacific (JAKK -20.5%) unravel after the firm releases updated 2011 guidance hinged on what it labels as a "disappointing" sales performance. The firm now sees full year revenue of $660M, down from a previous estimate of $770M-$775M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • NSANY

    Nissan (OTCPK:NSANY) recalls 34K Sentra compact cars due to battery cable problems that could...

    Nissan (OTCPK:NSANY) recalls 34K Sentra compact cars due to battery cable problems that could lead to a stalled engine, as well as 28K Juke crossover SUVs due to an unrelated turbocharger bracket problem. Shares bucked a downward trend in Asia, gaining 2.1% in Tokyo trading after the carmaker announced it will turn an engine and transmission subsidiary into a fully owned unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • SCHN

    Schnitzer Steel's (SCHN -5.5%) harsh preliminary estimate for Q1 EPS delivers a mixed reaction...

    Schnitzer Steel's (SCHN -5.5%) harsh preliminary estimate for Q1 EPS delivers a mixed reaction in the sector, spilling over to taint shares of a few names and helping lift up others. Decliners: PKX -2.8%, X -0.5%. Gainers: AKS +1.5%, MT +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (CSTR +2.1%) shares bounce after a weekend Barron's story asserts that the stock could...

    Coinstar (CSTR +2.1%) shares bounce after a weekend Barron's story asserts that the stock could rally 40%-plus as the company continues to expand its DVD rental kiosk business. One potential catalyst: announcement of a digital strategy, as speculation has the company partnering with Verizon, which recently said it intends to develop a streaming video service.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold (NYSE:EGO) trades 6.6% lower in premarket action after announcing it snapped up...

    Eldorado Gold (NYSE:EGO) trades 6.6% lower in premarket action after announcing it snapped up European Goldfields (OTC:EGFDF) for a cool ~C$2.5B. Bloomberg reports the bid price came in a little pricey at 5.1X European Goldfields' assets vs. 2.2X for 10 comparable deals in the gold sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM

  • Market preview: EU and U.S. investors shrug off the death of Kim Jong Il despite the news...

    Market preview: EU and U.S. investors shrug off the death of Kim Jong Il despite the news sending Asia into a spin, with S&P futures +0.6%. Optimisim ahead of more talks between eurozone finmins is apparently supporting stocks despite negative reports about the discussions (I, II). What was that Albert Einstein said about insanity? Later: NAHB housing index.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • WINN

    Premarket gainers: WINN +72%. SQNM +7%. AMR +5%. TTM +4%. CVC +4%. CPST +3%.Losers: MAS -6%....

    Premarket gainers: WINN +72%. SQNM +7%. AMR +5%. TTM +4%. CVC +4%. CPST +3%.
    Losers: MAS -6%. SCHN -6%. EGO -6%. LPL -6%. SNV -4%. LYG -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • PDLI

    PDL BioPharma (NASDAQ:PDLI) -3.5% premarket after issuing downward guidance for its Q4 and...

    PDL BioPharma (NASDAQ:PDLI) -3.5% premarket after issuing downward guidance for its Q4 and FY2012 revenue, citing reduced royalties from the sale of two drugs. PDL, which obtains most of its revenue from development and licensing of antibodies, generally has seen its bottom line improve in recent quarters amid lower expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • URI

    RBC Capital slots in United Rentals (NYSE:URI) as a Top Pick with a lofty $42 price target in...

    RBC Capital slots in United Rentals (NYSE:URI) as a Top Pick with a lofty $42 price target in the wake of its big investment in RSC Holdings (NYSE:RRR-OLD). Shares +1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • PCRX

    Shares of Pacira Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PCRX) gain 3.3% premarket after the firm publishes data...

    Shares of Pacira Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PCRX) gain 3.3% premarket after the firm publishes data showing that its Exparel analgesic eases postsurgical pain.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) +3.4% premarket after announcing Hong Kong securities regulators...

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) +3.4% premarket after announcing Hong Kong securities regulators decided not to take any action against its Sands China unit and have cleared it of one of several regulatory issues the company faces.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • SCHN

    Trading resumes for Schnitzer Steel (NASDAQ:SCHN), with shares -5.75% after the company's...

    Trading resumes for Schnitzer Steel (NASDAQ:SCHN), with shares -5.75% after the company's preliminary earnings announcement fell far short of expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX) revises its Q3 forecast, saying it now sees sales down 9%-12% after...

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX) revises its Q3 forecast, saying it now sees sales down 9%-12% after previous guidance targeted sales dropping off in a range of 3%-8%. The firm says the tail off in sales is attributable to a decline in its large customer business in its Communications segment. Shares -1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • ALXA

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) said late Friday it has retained Lazard to help it explore...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) said late Friday it has retained Lazard to help it explore strategic options, as the drug company hands all of its employees 60-day layoff notices to conserve cash. The stock is down 47% YTD. ALXA -15.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • SCHN

    Schnitzer Steel (NASDAQ:SCHN) reports preliminary 2012 Q1 EPS of $0.18-$0.25 against consensus...

    Schnitzer Steel (NASDAQ:SCHN) reports preliminary 2012 Q1 EPS of $0.18-$0.25 against consensus of $0.55, citing weaker than anticipated global market conditions for recycled metals. The company says operating margins contracted more than expected during the quarter as selling prices dove. Shares are halted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) rises 4% after announcing "numerous leading healthcare providers" in the...

    Aussie oil producer Woodside Petroleum (OTCPK:WOPEY, -3.4% in Australia) may delay an investment decision to develop the Browse liquefied natgas venture because of rising costs.
